## If() function

Wraps a function and only calls through if a given set of predicates return truthy

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function If(...fns: TFunction<boolean>[]): (target: any, key: string, desc: TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>) => void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  fns | <code>TFunction&lt;boolean&gt;[]</code> | The predicates to check before executing the decorated function |

<b>Returns:</b>

`(target: any, key: string, desc: TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, any[], any>>) => void`

## Remarks


## Example


```TS
  @If(wasPrevented)
  private doSomething(ev: Event) {
    // only executed if wasPrevented returns true
  }

```
